channel.title: Terraria
channel.description:
Well, the topic is Terraria. For those of you who don't know, it's a game that's very similar to minecraft. In my opinion (and many others from whom I have asked), the game is much more in-depth than minecraft and can entertain a large amount of people for a much longer period of time.
The question is, would you like to see a moparscape community-based Terraria server?
I know currently there is one for minecraft, which aroused this idea.
P.S. I brought this up because multiplayer is much more fun, and I'd like to see one made.

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Hmm that’s much better. Although it will still be a problem with griefers this removes most of them. I’d love to play vanilla but obviously with the maturity level it will just not work :L

Read full topic

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

ytuio9:

Ok last 2-3 posts were not made by me, probably one of my friends on my PC. I see your point with the bed thing but it’s never a nice thing to have to change the spawn every time someone decides to break something around it. Also it’s bad when someone makes a wall and protects it so people can’t cross it to the other side.

Maximum height of a structure being ~100 tiles? That’s more than enough for a house, especially because you can build sideways. Also, a magic mirror could teleport you to the main house of the server, containing npc’s, and another (useless) item (such as an Angel Statue) could teleport you to your own house.

Read full topic

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

You can change the set spawn, it’s designated by the server, which is open source.

Edit: Designated by the server, which loads the map. On the server side you could make the original spawn point where new users spawn, and then each user has an individual spawn that they create with a bed elsewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:61, topic:410288”]Rofl fuck off retard you might want to read what I posted:

[quote]
How about when someone goes around destroying beds?
[/quote][/quote]

eyeownyew:

People edited the Terraria server software to add rights and whatever else you want to imagine (player territories, whatever).

Same applies to beds, chests, and whatever other objects/tiles/items you want to apply it to.
The server software is open source, it’s not like it’s a massive project to change it.

Read full topic

Each player has an individual spawn? Think logically facepalm

Is this a fucking joke? How about when someone goes around destroying beds? Also no they don’t have a fucking individual spawn, whatever gave you have been playing was not terraria.
[/quote][quote author=ziplock link=topic=511571.msg3717062#msg3717062 date=1313706532]
Could easily be changed. facewall
[/quote]
ytuio9, you may want to see a neurologist. Read what was posted before you post.[/quote]
Rofl ok fuck off retard you might want to read what I posted:

How about when someone goes around destroying beds?
PS. there's no way you can change the set spawn on a server without modifying the game code

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

ziplock:

You could implement your own, could you not?

You can.[quote=“ytuio9, post:51, topic:410288”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=511571.msg3715592#msg3715592 date=1313616995]

It’s at 1.0.6.0, also I don’t see how the 1.0.6.x update fixes any player maturity problems???

There’s server software to fix the maturity problems.

Protip: only major server software change was in 1.0.3 when they added the console server executable

Protip2: People edited the Terraria server software to add rights and whatever else you want to imagine (player territories, whatever).
#Winning
(Not advertisement, just proving a point): Click here
[/quote]
Protip3: this isn’t minecraft, the amount of space you can build on is limited. inb4 people build a huge wall and claim it for theirs. Also I have already tried tmod with a friend of mine ages ago and it lagged a lot, and outright disconnected when we were in a fight with a boss and used lots of weapons, explosive and such.
My point remains: there were no server updates that protect the server from griefers and the like.[/quote]
It’s been updated a lot, and on a large world that is not nearly a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

zyle1992:

Played it. Didn’t like it. Felt as though it was a 2D rip off of minecraft (with some RPG elements mixed in)

Exactly, and some points were just annoying (the fucking worm chasing you).

Crafting will forever be much more appreciated in minecraft after playing this as well. I felt as though selecting from a list, as long as you had the required the items you get it, was just too simple. It created no real knowledge needed for the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

ytuio9:

Err, 50 hours and haven’t completed all there is to the game? I don’t think it was that big. I was able to explore every area in the game except for the underground jungle on a large map in like 20 hours. It was very fun in multiplayer, however, and that was with only 3 people on a server. More people would definitely be more fun - just not on moparscape, the maturity of most people on this community wouldn’t allow for a game like this to be hosted publicly.

There have been many updates, changing that greatly.

Read full topic

item.title: Terraria
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:41, topic:410288”][quote author=_s link=topic=511571.msg3713924#msg3713924 date=1313520348]
you said something ridiculously stupid, whether this is your topic or not it’s irrelevant and you should have done prior research to avoid looking like an idiot by trying to discuss something you have no knowledge of.

edit: ps i don’t believe i’m the ignorant one here when you’re the one that’s willing to resort to guesswork in discussion…
[/quote]
It wasn’t guesswork. I don’t work with any of the C languages, and I have heard one or more of them are windows-only programming languages. Fuck off. You’re very ignorant.[/quote]… none of them are windows only, what are you smoking? Stop being retarded and just shut up already.

Read full topic
